meanings.definition: Of or relating to a seigneur or seigniory.
meanings.sent1: The seigneurial manor was well-maintained and grand.
meanings.sent2: The historian studied the seigneurial system in depth.
meanings.sent3: The seigneurial cat ruled over the other pets in the house.
meanings.sent4: Her seigneurial presence commanded respect from all who met her.
meanings.sent5: The seigneurial estate stood proudly against the backdrop of the countryside.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the system of land tenure and organization of rural society in medieval Europe.
meanings.sent1: The seigneurial lands were divided among the peasants.
meanings.sent2: Life in the seigneurial manor was both challenging and rewarding.
meanings.sent3: The seigneurial chickens had a meeting to discuss their coop arrangements.
meanings.sent4: The seigneurial system was like a complex puzzle that needed solving.
meanings.sent5: The seigneurial village bustled with activity during the harvest season.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a lord or feudal lord.
meanings.sent1: The seigneurial castle was a symbol of power and authority.
meanings.sent2: The knights served their seigneurial lord with loyalty and honor.
meanings.sent3: The seigneurial banquet featured an abundance of delicious food.
meanings.sent4: His seigneurial title came with great responsibilities.
meanings.sent5: The seigneurial portrait captured the essence of nobility and strength.
